verses.roman:
upagīyamāna-carito
vanitābhir halāyudha
vaneṣu vyacarat kṣīvo
mada-vihvala-locanaḥ

synonyms: upagīyamāna—being sung; caritaḥ—His pastimes; vanitābhiḥ—with the women; halāyudhaḥ—Lord Balarāma; vaneṣu—among the forests; vyacarat—wandered; kṣīvaḥ—inebriated; mada—by the intoxication; vihvala—overcome; locanaḥ—His eyes.
translation: As His deeds were sung, Lord Halāyudha wandered as if inebriated among the various forests with His girlfriends. His eyes rolled from the effects of the liquor.
